p: Defensins are small, cysteine-rich cationic peptides that act as important effectors of the innate immune system (Ding et al. 2009; Ganz 2003). Human defensins are classified according to their structure, α and β-defensins differing in their disulphide bond pairing, and θ-defensins, being present in Old World monkeys, displaying a circular structure (Lehrer 2004). Of note, despite RNA transcripts for θ-defensins are found in human bone marrow cells, a premature stop codon prevents protein translation (Nguyen et al. 2010).
